comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: The series of photos, from this one, 104-32, to 104-14, appear to have been taken during the survey, in 1910, of the boundary between German East Africa and what was then Northeast Rhodesia, which comprised what are now the Northern and Eastern provinces of Zambia.  The trace of the boundary was laid down in detail in a British-German agreement of 1901, from the mouth of the Songwe River at the north end of Lake Nyasa to the mouth of the Kalambo River at the south end of Lake Tanganyika - source: "African Boundaries: A Legal and Diplomatic Encyclopaedia", found on Google Books.
